authors.name: Bonnie Evans
authors.affiliation: MRC Laboratory of Medical Sciences; Imperial College London

before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"5o6nc","text":"Make the 50% glycerol solution by diluting 100% glycerol in dH20 and autoclaving.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

28852.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aulor","text":"Obtain an LB agar plate with appropriate antibiotic if any.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"872qa","text":"Label the bottom of the plate with the strain name and the date. It is also a good idea to add the antibiotic resistance (if any) and your initials.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"533de","text":"Sterilize your lab bench by spraying it down with 70% ethanol and wiping it down with a paper towel. Maintain sterility by working near a flame or bunsen burner.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b9m4k","text":"Find the bacteria of interest from the bacterial stock database and obtain the appropriate glycerol stock from the -80C freezer (Freezer 6- Bacterial Stock box)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9id8h","text":"Using a sterile pipette tip touch the top of the glycerol stock to obtain the bacteria on the tip","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9j6no","text":"Gently spread the bacteria over a section of the plate, as shown in the diagram below, to create streak #1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"as0nk","text":"Using a fresh, sterile pipette tip, drag through streak #1 and spread the bacteria over a second section of the plate, to create streak #2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5dsja","text":"Using a third sterile pipette tip, drag through streak #2 and spread the bacteria over the last section of the plate, to create streak #3","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9p9fe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dtk0g","text":"The repeated streaking is done to dilute the bacteria and obtain single colonies.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"69s4r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dcbxm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"beiu9","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":null,"entityRanges":null,"data":{}},{"key":"y1qp8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9r1sh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"C1D7B308344611EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":249.90291262135943,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"","source":"https://content.protocols.io/public/bff09da62904587ef28bc633ab06d0e330c40e309a76231b7d5d7c4b1d402ebc/bsmh3npn.png","type":1,"width":286.0000000000002}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"C1D7B445344611EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":206.8235294117647,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"","source":"https://content.protocols.io/public/bff09da62904587ef28bc633ab06d0e330c40e309a76231b7d5d7c4b1d402ebc/bsmi3npn.png","type":1,"width":293}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"91sjr","text":"Incubate the plate (lid side down) with the newly plated bacteria overnight (generally 12-18 hours) at the appropriate growth temperature for the particular strain. In case of antibiotic resistant plasmids, incubation should not exceed the recommended duration as it poses risk of the bacteria metabolising the antibiotic.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fr5v0","text":"Following adequate incubation, single colonies should be visible. A single colony should look like a white dot growing on the solid medium. This dot is composed of millions of genetically identical bacteria that arose from a single bacterium. If the bacterial growth is too dense and you do not see single colonies, re-streak onto a new agar plate to obtain single colonies.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a55hf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b4t8h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"34on2","text":"Store the streaked plates at 4C (lid side down to avoid condensation falling on the single colonies). The streaked plates can be used for up to a month to make liquid cultures.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

29207.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fm6uj","text":"Obtain LB Broth from the Media kitchen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"817ee","text":"LB Broth contents:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7k94l","text":"4 g NaCl","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"234vn","text":"4 g Tryptone","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bf8pp","text":"2 g Yeast Extract","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fvoqg","text":"dH2O to 400 mL","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":2,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8mtd7","text":"Add liquid LB to a tube or flask and add the appropriate antibiotic (if required) to the correct concentration (see table below).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"43opf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e1cur","text":"Antibiotic Concentrations","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6ft1j","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fqaa7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":25},{"style":"bold","offset":34,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ormh","text":"Note: If you intend to do a mini-prep you will usually want to start 2 mL in a falcon tube, but for larger preps you might want to use as much as a litre of LB in a 2 L Erlenmeyer flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","6_0":"","6_1":"","7_0":"","7_1":"","8_0":"","8_1":"","9_0":"","9_1":""},"colWidths":[50,50],"data":[["   \u003cb\u003eCommonly Used Antibiotics\u003c/b\u003e   ","   \u003cb\u003eRecommended Concentration\u003c/b\u003e   "],["  Ampicillin  ","  100 µg/mL  "],["  Bleocin  ","  5 µg/mL  "],["  Carbenicillin  ","  100 µg/mL  "],["  Chloramphenicol  ","  25 µg/mL  "],["  Coumermycin  ","  25 µg/mL  "],["  Gentamycin  ","  10 µg/mL  "],["  Kanamycin  ","  50 µg/mL  "],["  Spectinomycin  ","  50 µg/mL  "],["  Tetracycline  ","  10 µg/mL  "]],"guid":"D0D30710F76111E9A71C91C23E5C71A8","legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"21mge","text":"Antibiotic concentrations","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mergeCells":[],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23],"show_headers":true}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9qml6","text":"Using a sterile inoculation loop, select a single colony from your bacteria streaked LB agar plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"36b3c","text":"Dip the inoculation loop into the liquid LB and swirl.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7v4vj","text":"Discard the inoculation loop.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ets20","text":"Loosely cover the culture with sterile aluminium foil or a cap that is not air tight as bacteria needs air.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2fs0c","text":"Incubate the bacterial culture at the required growth temperature overnight (i.e. 12-18 hrs in general) in a shaking incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1qs89","text":"After incubation, check for growth, which is characterized by a cloudy haze in the media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9lfjb","text":"Measure the optical density of the bacterial culture at 600nm wavelength using a spectrophotometer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8pct0","text":"Record the OD600 three times and calculate average, use LB Broth as Blank.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fur1d","text":"Bacterial glycerol stocks are important for long-term storage. Bacteria on LB agar plate can be stored at 4°C for a few weeks. However, if you want to store bacteria for a longer time, you will need to establish glycerol stocks. The addition of glycerol stabilizes the frozen bacteria, preventing damage to the cell membranes and keeping the cells alive. A glycerol stock of bacteria can be stored stably at -80°C for many years.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

fork_info.title: Creating Bacterial Glycerol Stocks for Long-term Storage

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d6go5","text":"Grow an overnight culture of the selected strain","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bffu8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"93io4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":29207,"title":"Inoculating a Liquid Bacterial Culture","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eInoculating a Liquid Bacterial Culture\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"inoculating-a-liquid-bacterial-culture-8rxhv7n","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Priota Islam","affiliation":"Imperial College London","affiliation_url":"http://behave.lms.mrc.ac.uk/","username":"priota-islam","link":"https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Priota_Islam","image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/86b3npn.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/86b3npn.jpg","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":7},"type_id":1,"guid":"248D8900F75F11E9A71C91C23E5C71A8"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ab845","text":"Add 500 μL of the overnight culture to 500 μL of 50% glycerol in a 2 mL screw top tube or cryotube and gently mix","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fjsoi","text":"To recover bacteria from your glycerol stock, open the tube and use a sterile loop or pipette tip to scrape some of the frozen bacteria off of the top. Do not let the glycerol stock thaw! ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3nlh0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6t6o5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":28852,"title":"Streaking and Isolating Bacteria on a LB Agar Plate","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eStreaking and Isolating Bacteria on a LB Agar Plate\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"streaking-and-isolating-bacteria-on-a-lb-agar-plat-8euhtew","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Priota Islam","affiliation":"Imperial College London","affiliation_url":"http://behave.lms.mrc.ac.uk/","username":"priota-islam","link":"https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Priota_Islam","image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/86b3npn.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/86b3npn.jpg","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":9},"type_id":1,"guid":"23984F40F19B11E99D09796447EEE3F7"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"443ia","text":"Shake the glycerol 5-6 times before freezing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fqs64","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5mrr4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3ulgl","text":"One uniform solution, no layers present","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"65BBFB143CC346F591A41E3E9E2EFF18"}}}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"3s82e","text":"Snap top tubes are not recommended as they can open unexpectedly at -80°C","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6paa","text":"Be sure to label both the lid and the tube of a glycerol stock before you place the sample at -80°C. Frozen tubes are hard to write on and samples stored for long periods at -80°C can lose labels stuck to tube!","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ec5t0","text":"Try not to freeze/thaw your glycerol stock too many times as this will reduce the shelf life. Placing the glycerol stock on dry ice while streaking onto LB agar will prevent it from thawing completely.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
